SourceProxy.label: Evenly Spaced Streamlines 2D
SourceProxy.name: EvenlySpacedStreamlines2D

Documentation.long_help: Produce evenly spaced streamlines in a 2D vector field.
Documentation.short_help: Produce evenly spaced streamlines in a 2D vector field.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter generates evenly spaced streamlines in a 2D vector field from a start position. Production of streamlines terminates if a streamline crosses the exterior boundary of the input dataset (ReasonForTermination=1), an initialization issue (ReasonForTermination=2), computing an unexpected value (ReasonForTermination=3), reached the Maximum Streamline Length input value (ReasonForTermination=4), reached the Maximum Steps input value (ReasonForTermination=5), velocity was lower than the Terminal Speed input value (ReasonForTermination=6), a streamline formed a loop (ReasonForTermination=7), and the streamline was too close to other streamlines (ReasonForTermination=8). This filter operates on a 2D dataset aligned with plane XY with point-centered vectors aligned with plane XY. The output is polygonal data containing polylines.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the filter.

StringVectorProperty.label: Vectors
StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the name of the vector array from which to generate streamlines.

IntVectorProperty.name: InterpolatorType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines which interpolator to use for evaluating the velocity vector field. The first is faster though the second is more robust in locating cells during streamline integration.

IntVectorProperty.name: IntegratorType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines which integrator (with increasing accuracy) to use for creating streamlines.

IntVectorProperty.label: Integration Step Unit
IntVectorProperty.name: IntegrationStepUnit
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the unit for Initial integration step size. The Length unit refers to the arc length that a particle travels/advects within a single step. The Cell Length unit represents the step size as a number of cells.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Initial Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.name: InitialIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the initial integration step size. For non-adaptive integrators (Runge-Kutta 2 and Runge-Kutta 4), it is fixed (always equal to this initial value) throughout the integration.

IntVectorProperty.label: Maximum Steps
IntVectorProperty.name: MaximumNumberOfSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum number of steps, beyond which streamline integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Separating Distance
DoubleVectorProperty.name: SeparatingDistance
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify the separating distance between streamlines expressed in IntegrationStepUnit.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Separating Distance Ratio
DoubleVectorProperty.name: SeparatingDistanceRatio
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Specifies SeparatingDistanceRatio. If streamlines get closer than SeparatingDistance * SeparatingDistanceRatio to other streamlines integration stops.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Closed Loop Maximum Distance
DoubleVectorProperty.name: ClosedLoopMaximumDistance
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Loops are considered closed if the have two points at distance less than this. This is expressed in IntegrationStepUnit.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Start Position
DoubleVectorProperty.name: StartPosition
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify the starting point (seed) of the first streamline in the global coordinate system.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Terminal Speed
DoubleVectorProperty.name: TerminalSpeed
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the terminal speed, below which particle advection/integration is terminated.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeVorticity
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify whether or not to compute vorticity.

SourceProxy.name: ParticlePath

Documentation.long_help: Trace Particle Paths through time in a vector field.
Documentation.short_help: Trace Particle Paths through time in a vector field.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Particle Trace filter generates pathlines in a vector field from a collection of seed points. The vector field used is selected from the Vectors menu, so the input data set is required to have point-centered vectors. The Seed portion of the interface allows you to select whether the seed points for this integration lie in a point cloud or along a line. Depending on which is selected, the appropriate 3D widget (point or line widget) is displayed along with traditional user interface controls for positioning the point cloud or line within the data set. Instructions for using the 3D widgets and the corresponding manual controls can be found in section 7.4. This filter operates on any type of data set, provided it has point-centered vectors. The output is polygonal data containing polylines. This filter is available on the Toolbar.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Specify which is the Input of the StreamTracer filter.

InputProperty.label: Seed Source
InputProperty.name: Source
InputProperty.Documentation: Specify the seed dataset. Typically from where the vector field integration should begin. Usually a point/radius or a line with a given resolution.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: TerminationTime
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Setting TerminationTime to a positive value will cause particles to terminate when the time is reached. The units of time should be consistent with the primary time variable.

IntVectorProperty.name: ForceReinjectionEveryNSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When animating particles, it is nice to inject new ones every Nth step to produce a continuous flow. Setting ForceReinjectionEveryNSteps to a non zero value will cause the particle source to reinject particles every Nth step even if it is otherwise unchanged. Note that if the particle source is also animated, this flag will be redundant as the particles will be reinjected whenever the source changes anyway

IntVectorProperty.name: StaticSeeds
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the input seeds are not changing, then this can be set to 1 to avoid having to do a repeated grid search that would return the exact same result.

IntVectorProperty.name: StaticMesh
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the input grid is not changing, then this can be set to 1 to avoid having to create cell locators for each update.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify which vector array should be used for the integration through that filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeVorticity
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Compute vorticity and angular rotation of particles as they progress

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Terminal Speed
DoubleVectorProperty.name: TerminalSpeed
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the terminal speed, below which particle advection/integration is terminated.

SourceProxy.name: ParticleTracer

Documentation.long_help: Trace Particles through time in a vector field.
Documentation.short_help: Trace Particles through time in a vector field.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Particle Trace filter generates pathlines in a vector field from a collection of seed points. The vector field used is selected from the Vectors menu, so the input data set is required to have point-centered vectors. The Seed portion of the interface allows you to select whether the seed points for this integration lie in a point cloud or along a line. Depending on which is selected, the appropriate 3D widget (point or line widget) is displayed along with traditional user interface controls for positioning the point cloud or line within the data set. Instructions for using the 3D widgets and the corresponding manual controls can be found in section 7.4. This filter operates on any type of data set, provided it has point-centered vectors. The output is polygonal data containing polylines. This filter is available on the Toolbar.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Specify which is the Input of the StreamTracer filter.

InputProperty.label: Seed Source
InputProperty.name: Source
InputProperty.Documentation: Specify the seed dataset. Typically from where the vector field integration should begin. Usually a point/radius or a line with a given resolution.

IntVectorProperty.name: StaticSeeds
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the input seeds are not changing, then this can be set to 1 to avoid having to do a repeated grid search that would return the exact same result.

IntVectorProperty.name: StaticMesh
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the input grid is not changing, then this can be set to 1 to avoid having to create cell locators for each update.

IntVectorProperty.name: ForceReinjectionEveryNSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When animating particles, it is nice to inject new ones every Nth step to produce a continuous flow. Setting ForceReinjectionEveryNSteps to a non zero value will cause the particle source to reinject particles every Nth step even if it is otherwise unchanged. Note that if the particle source is also animated, this flag will be redundant as the particles will be reinjected whenever the source changes anyway

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify which vector array should be used for the integration through that filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeVorticity
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Compute vorticity and angular rotation of particles as they progress

SourceProxy.name: StreakLine

Documentation.long_help: Trace Streak lines through time in a vector field.
Documentation.short_help: Trace Streak lines through time in a vector field.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Particle Trace filter generates pathlines in a vector field from a collection of seed points. The vector field used is selected from the Vectors menu, so the input data set is required to have point-centered vectors. The Seed portion of the interface allows you to select whether the seed points for this integration lie in a point cloud or along a line. Depending on which is selected, the appropriate 3D widget (point or line widget) is displayed along with traditional user interface controls for positioning the point cloud or line within the data set. Instructions for using the 3D widgets and the corresponding manual controls can be found in section 7.4. This filter operates on any type of data set, provided it has point-centered vectors. The output is polygonal data containing polylines. This filter is available on the Toolbar.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Specify which is the Input of the StreamTracer filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: StaticSeeds
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the input seeds are not changing, then this can be set to 1 to avoid having to do a repeated grid search that would return the exact same result.

IntVectorProperty.name: StaticMesh
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If the input grid is not changing, then this can be set to 1 to avoid having to create cell locators for each update.

InputProperty.label: Seed Source
InputProperty.name: Source
InputProperty.Documentation: Specify the seed dataset. Typically from where the vector field integration should begin. Usually a point/radius or a line with a given resolution.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: TerminationTime
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: Setting TerminationTime to a positive value will cause particles to terminate when the time is reached. The units of time should be consistent with the primary time variable.

IntVectorProperty.name: ForceReinjectionEveryNSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When animating particles, it is nice to inject new ones every Nth step to produce a continuous flow. Setting ForceReinjectionEveryNSteps to a non zero value will cause the particle source to reinject particles every Nth step even if it is otherwise unchanged. Note that if the particle source is also animated, this flag will be redundant as the particles will be reinjected whenever the source changes anyway

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify which vector array should be used for the integration through that filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeVorticity
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Compute vorticity and angular rotation of particles as they progress

IntVectorProperty.name: DisableResetCache
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Prevents cache from getting reset so that new computation always start from previous results.

SourceProxy.label: Stream Tracer
SourceProxy.name: StreamTracer

Documentation.long_help: Integrate streamlines in a vector field.
Documentation.short_help: Integrate streamlines in a vector field.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Stream Tracer filter generates streamlines in a vector field from a collection of seed points. Production of streamlines terminates if a streamline crosses the exterior boundary of the input dataset (ReasonForTermination=1). Other reasons for termination include an initialization issue (ReasonForTermination=2), computing an unexpected value (ReasonForTermination=3), reached the Maximum Streamline Length input value (ReasonForTermination=4), reached the Maximum Steps input value (ReasonForTermination=5), and velocity was lower than the Terminal Speed input value (ReasonForTermination=6). This filter operates on any type of dataset, provided it has point-centered vectors. The output is polygonal data containing polylines.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Stream Tracer filter.

StringVectorProperty.label: Vectors
StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the name of the vector array from which to generate streamlines.

IntVectorProperty.name: InterpolatorType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines which interpolator to use for evaluating the velocity vector field. The first is faster though the second is more robust in locating cells during streamline integration.

IntVectorProperty.name: Surface Streamlines
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify whether or not to compute surface streamlines.

IntVectorProperty.name: IntegrationDirection
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines in which direction(s) a streamline is generated.

IntVectorProperty.name: IntegratorType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines which integrator (with increasing accuracy) to use for creating streamlines.

IntVectorProperty.label: Integration Step Unit
IntVectorProperty.name: IntegrationStepUnit
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the unit for Minimum/Initial/Maximum integration step size. The Length unit refers to the arc length that a particle travels/advects within a single step. The Cell Length unit represents the step size as a number of cells.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Initial Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.name: InitialIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the initial integration step size. For non-adaptive integrators (Runge-Kutta 2 and Runge-Kutta 4), it is fixed (always equal to this initial value) throughout the integration. For an adaptive integrator (Runge-Kutta 4-5), the actual step size varies such that the numerical error is less than a specified threshold.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Minimum Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.name: MinimumIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: When using the Runge-Kutta 4-5 integrator, this property specifies the minimum integration step size.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Maximum Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaximumIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: When using the Runge-Kutta 4-5 integrator, this property specifies the maximum integration step size.

IntVectorProperty.label: Maximum Steps
IntVectorProperty.name: MaximumNumberOfSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum number of steps, beyond which streamline integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Maximum Streamline Length
DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaximumPropagation
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum streamline length (i.e., physical arc length), beyond which line integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Terminal Speed
DoubleVectorProperty.name: TerminalSpeed
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the terminal speed, below which particle advection/integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaximumError
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum error (for Runge-Kutta 4-5) tolerated throughout streamline integration. The Runge-Kutta 4-5 integrator tries to adjust the step size such that the estimated error is less than this threshold.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeVorticity
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify whether or not to compute vorticity.

InputProperty.label: Seed Type
InputProperty.name: Source
InputProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines how the seeds for the streamlines will be generated.

SourceProxy.label: Stream Tracer With Custom Source
SourceProxy.name: ArbitrarySourceStreamTracer

Documentation.long_help: Integrate streamlines in a vector field.
Documentation.short_help: Integrate streamlines in a vector field.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Stream Tracer With Custom Source filter generates streamlines in a vector field from a collection of seed points. Production of streamlines terminates if a streamline crosses the exterior boundary of the input dataset (ReasonForTermination=1). Other reasons for termination include an initialization issue (ReasonForTermination=2), computing an unexpected value (ReasonForTermination=3), reached the Maximum Streamline Length input value (ReasonForTermination=4), reached the Maximum Steps input value (ReasonForTermination=5), and velocity was lower than the Terminal Speed input value (ReasonForTermination=6). This filter operates on any type of dataset, provided it has point-centered vectors. The output is polygonal data containing polylines. This filter takes a Source input that provides the seed points.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Stream Tracer filter.

StringVectorProperty.label: Vectors
StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputVectors
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the name of the vector array from which to generate streamlines.

IntVectorProperty.name: InterpolatorType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines which interpolator to use for evaluating the velocity vector field. The first is faster though the second is more robust in locating cells during streamline integration.

IntVectorProperty.name: Surface Streamlines
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify whether or not to compute surface streamlines.

IntVectorProperty.name: IntegrationDirection
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines in which direction(s) a streamline is generated.

IntVectorProperty.name: IntegratorType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property determines which integrator (with increasing accuracy) to use for creating streamlines.

IntVectorProperty.label: Integration Step Unit
IntVectorProperty.name: IntegrationStepUnit
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the unit for Minimum/Initial/Maximum integration step size. The Length unit refers to the arc length that a particle travels/advects within a single step. The Cell Length unit represents the step size as a number of cells.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Initial Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.name: InitialIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the initial integration step size. For non-adaptive integrators (Runge-Kutta 2 and Runge-Kutta 4), it is fixed (always equal to this initial value) throughout the integration. For an adaptive integrator (Runge-Kutta 4-5), the actual step size varies such that the numerical error is less than a specified threshold.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Minimum Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.name: MinimumIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: When using the Runge-Kutta 4-5 integrator, this property specifies the minimum integration step size.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Maximum Step Length
DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaximumIntegrationStep
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: When using the Runge-Kutta 4-5 integrator, this property specifies the maximum integration step size.

IntVectorProperty.label: Maximum Steps
IntVectorProperty.name: MaximumNumberOfSteps
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum number of steps, beyond which streamline integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Maximum Streamline Length
DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaximumPropagation
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum streamline length (i.e., physical arc length), beyond which line integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Terminal Speed
DoubleVectorProperty.name: TerminalSpeed
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the terminal speed, below which particle advection/integration is terminated.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: MaximumError
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the maximum error (for Runge-Kutta 4-5) tolerated throughout streamline integration. The Runge-Kutta 4-5 integrator tries to adjust the step size such that the estimated error is less than this threshold.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeVorticity
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Specify whether or not to compute vorticity.

InputProperty.label: Seed Source
InputProperty.name: Source
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input used to obtain the seed points.

SourceProxy.name: VortexCores
SourceProxy.label: Vortex Cores

Documentation.short_help: Compute vortex cores of a vector field

SourceProxy.Documentation: Compute vortex core lines using the parallel vectors method. By default, the "Higher-Order" approach of computing the parallel vector lines between the flow field's velocity and jerk is disabled in favor of computing the parallel vector lines between the velocity and acceleration. To further discriminate against spurious vortex cores, at each potential point value the Q-criterion, delta-criterion, lambda_ci, and lambda_2-criterion are checked. The Q-criterion and delta-criterion are used to prefilter cells prior to the execution of the parallel lines algorithm, and all criteria values are stored as point values on the output polylines.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputArray
StringVectorProperty.label: Vector Field
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates the name of the vector array from which to compute vortex cores.

IntVectorProperty.name: UseHigherOrderMethod
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Use the flow field's jerk instead of acceleration as the second vector field during the parallel vector operation. Disabled by default.
